case_title: DALSUKH RAI JAIDAYAL, In re vs N/A
case_number: I. T. A. No. 2623 of 19Case No. 15 of 1952
legal_issue: Whether the assessee family is entitled to exemption from tax under section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act for the period October 19, 1942, to October 7, 1943.

legal_principles.section_25_4: Exemption from tax for the period between the end of the previous year and the date of succession.
legal_principles.bombay_high_court_precedent: Ambaram Kalidas v. Commissioner of Income-tax

key_findings.income_exempt_period: None, as no income was earned between October 7, 1943, and October 8, 1943.

reasoning.interpretation: The previous year for section 25(4) is the completed accounting year immediately preceding the date of succession.
reasoning.application: No income was earned between the end of the previous year and the date of succession, thus no exemption applies.

costs.final_costs: Parties to bear their own costs

citations: Commissioner of Income-tax v. Srinivasan (1953) 23 ITR 87 SC
Ambaram Kalidas v. Commissioner of Income-tax (1951) 19 ITR 227 Bom
